title: Lesson 14
paragraph: Walking, wanting, watching and other common verbs for daily routines and preferences.

words.meaning: to move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot
words.example: I walk to school every day.

words.meaning: to be successful in a contest or competition
to hope for something that is not guaranteed
to perform tasks for a job or purpose
to feel anxious about possible problems
words.example: Don't worry, everything will be fine.

words.meaning: to form letters, words, or symbols on a surface
words.example: Write your name at the top.

words.meaning: to cook by dry heat, usually in an oven
words.example: She likes to bake bread on weekends.

words.meaning: to act in a specified manner
to clean or arrange with a brush
words.japaneseMeaning: 磨く／ブラッシングする

words.meaning: to strike the palms of the hands together to show approval
words.example: Clap loudly at the end of the show.
